items.title: Representative Eric Swalwell Will Run for California Governor
items.summary: Representative Eric Swalwell, a Democrat, is likely to emphasize his history of fighting President Trump, an approach that many Democratic voters say they want their elected officials to take.

items.title: Justice Dept. Sues California Over College Benefits for Undocumented Students
items.summary: The lawsuit is the third filed by the Justice Department against the state in a week.

items.title: Pras Michel of the Fugees Gets 14 Years for Illegal Foreign Influence Scheme
items.summary: Mr. Michel was convicted in April 2023 of 10 criminal counts, including money laundering, illegal lobbying and witness tampering.

items.title: Qaeda Convict Returns to Guantánamo Court 17 Years After Trial
items.summary: The Yemeni prisoner spent nearly seven hours at the war court, displaying some of the defiance of his 2008 proceeding.

items.title: Judge Concludes Prosecutors Can Circumvent Federal Grand Juries in D.C.
items.summary: The ruling by a federal judge found that federal prosecutors could fall back on local grand juries to approve serious charges when they failed to persuade a federal grand jury.

items.title: Coast Guard Says Swastika and Noose Displays Are No Longer Hate Incidents
items.summary: A new servicewide policy recasts swastikas and nooses as “politically divisive,” revises harassment provisions and deletes protections for transgender troops.

items.title: White House walks back Trump’s suggestion of executing Democrats, stands by ‘piggy’ insult to reporter– as it happened
items.summary: <p>This live blog is now closed.</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/20/trump-news-at-a-glance-democrats">Trump news at a glance: president says Democrats should be arrested for ‘seditious behavior’, drawing outrage</a></p></li></ul><p>The <strong><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a></strong> presented a new plan to roll back regulations in the <strong>Endangered Species Act (ESA)</strong> on Wednesday, a move experts fear will accelerate the extinction crisis if adopted.</p><p><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6">The proposed</a><strong><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6"> </a></strong><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6">changes</a> would allow the federal government more power to weigh economic impact against habitat designations, remove safeguards against future events – including the impacts from the climate crisis – and rescind the “blanket rule” that automatically grants threatened species the same protections as those designated as endangered.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/20/donald-trump-jeffrey-epstein-justice-department-zohran-mamdani-news-updates-us-politics-live">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump news at a glance: president says Democrats should be arrested for ‘seditious behavior’, drawing outrage
items.summary: <p>After Trump logged on and chose violence, Democratic leaders condemned his ‘disgusting and dangerous death threats’ – key US politics stories from 19 November</p><p>Donald Trump called for the arrest of a group of Democratic lawmakers he accused of engaging in “SEDITIOUS BEHAVIOR, punishable by DEATH”.</p><p>The president’s remarks, issued on his Truth Social platform on Thursday morning, came after the legislators <a href="https://x.com/SenatorSlotkin/status/1990774492356902948">posted a video</a> in which they told active service members they should refuse illegal orders.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/20/trump-news-at-a-glance-democrats">Continue reading...</a>
